chargeHist.descr: Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury

result.execSummary:
The defendant Byron O. Toledo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).
  • Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(2r).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Counseling shall specifically include:   Alcohol / drug, Psychiatric.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
*   Pay restitution in the sum of $4240.49 plus surcharges.
May not associate with gangs/gang members or gang affiliations.  May not have contact with Richard L, Ashley C, Teresa A, Wendi G, Jimmy W, Officer B, their houses or places of employment, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney P Cafferty.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 15 months w/conditions, concurrent on cts 1 & 2; restitution ordered in the amount of $4,240.49 (by stipulation of deft); deft to pay $500 DNA surcharge; bond applied to costs; credit for 30 days served if revoked.
filed by agent Kenya Mason

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney P Cafferty.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, cts 3, 4, 5 & 6 are dismissed and read in.  Deft pleads no contest to cts 1 & 2.  Court finds deft guilty of cts 1 & 2.  PSI ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  SEH 10/14/15 at 1:15pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney P Cafferty.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Case is not resolved.  JS set for 8/31/15 at 8:30am; JSH 8/13/15 at 1:15pm.  Bond continued.
With Shelley/Atty Cafferty the FPT of 3/20/15 at 10:30am is rescheduled; a Atty Cafferty is unavailable; reset to 4/29/15 at 8:45am.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney P Cafferty.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Victim A.C.'s parents present.  Atty Cafferty states he needs to discuss restitution with ADA Phan, does not have an offer.  FPT continued to 3/20/15 at 10:30am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney P Cafferty.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  For reasons set forth on the record, FPT continued to 2/26/15 at 10:30am.  Bond continued.

for substitution of attorneys.

Not to enter WI other than for appointments w/attorney or for court appearances; seek alcohol treatment at the VA; no contact by phone, by text, by social media of any sort with Richard L, Jimmy W., Travis G., Dana E., Ashley C, Teresa A., Wendi G. or any of their residences; premises of Aurora Hospital except for emergency medical purposes; no alcohol or controlled substances.

Assistant District Attorney Zachary Wittchow, special prosecutor, appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney P Cafferty.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court approves stipulation and order that Atty Cafferty is substituted as counsel in place of Atty Henry.  Atty Cafferty acknowledges receipt and waives reading.  Deft enters not guilty pleas.  Atty Cafferty requests to modify bond.  Court amends bond to $2,500 cash bond w/conditions; not to enter WI other than for appointments w/attorney or for court appearances; seek alcohol treatment at the VA; no contact by phone, by text, by social media of any sort with Richard L, Jimmy W., Travis G., Dana E., Ashley C, Teresa A., Wendi G. or any of their residences; premises of Aurora Hospital except for emergency medical purposes; no alcohol or controlled substances.  DA PTC 7/18/14 at 1:30pm and FPT 9/8/14 at 8:30am.
With attached Fax Transmittal Sheet
filed by Atty Cafferty
